intro: Ferula armandi, commonly known as the Armenian cow parsley, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family, and its leaves are finely divided with a strong, spicy scent. Ferula armandi is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and digestive benefits. Its resilience to harsh climates makes it an important species in its native ecosystems.
